results.title: Stark
results.creator_credit: Nadia Tass, Timothy White, David Parker, Michael Wearing, Film Victoria and Cascade Ash
results.brief_description: Stark, the most powerful secret society on Earth could buy the Earth a thousand times and still make a takeover bid on God. So why is Stark desperate to buy a large slab of Aboriginal land in the Australian outback? CD, (Ben Elton), doesn’t care about the world, but he does care about getting laid, especially by Rachel, (Jacqueline McKenzie), a beautiful rebel looking for a cause. Together with Zimmerman and Walter, two Vietnam veterans, dippy hippy Karen and Christie Kettel, a New York journalist, they take on Stark to try and save the world from a toxic conspiracy. Filmed entirely in Australia, Stark combines Ben Elton’s brash, individual humour with a serious environmental message.

results.title: Black rain
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Sherry Lansing, Stanley R. Jaffe and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Conklin, (Michael Douglas) and Charlie Douglas, (Andy Garcia) are strangers in a strange land. They are New York City cops in Japan, chasing Sato, (Yasuka Matsuda), an escaped murderer and a member of the Yakuza, (the Japanese Mafia). Director Ridley Scott takes the viewer on nightmare journey through the exotic, violent streets of Osaka, into the very heart of the deadly Yakuza. This fascinating thriller tells of men torn by a clash of culture and crime against honour.

results.title: The Boys from Brazil
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Stanley O'Toole, Martin Richards, Fox and Circle Productions
results.brief_description: A terrifying thriller based on the best-selling novel by Ira Levin. Living in South America, Dr. Josef Mengele, (Gregory Peck) gathers a group of former Nazis in his plan to clone Hitler. Barry Kohler, (Steve Guttenburg), informs famed Nazi hunter Ezra Lieberman, (Laurence Olivier). Kohler’s murder incites Lieberman to investigate, and he begins to unravel a conspiracy which leads to Mengele. Mengele has cloned 94 Hitlers, and is killing their fathers in order to simulate Hitler’s own youth. Suddenly, the terrifying extent of Mengele’s plan is revealed. Also stars James Mason, Denholm Elliot and Lilli Palmer.

results.title: The Omega man
results.creator_credit: Boris Sagal, Walter Seltzer and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Welcome to the future where humankind has been decimated due to the effects of biological warfare. Robert Neville, played by Charlton Heston, roams the windy, ghostly streets of Los Angeles, searching for supplies. At sundown, other “survivors” emerge; the blood-thirsty “Family”, neopeople who are not quite human. Rosalind Cash stars as the caretaker of a small but healthy band of children who represent the future of our species. Together, she and Heston, must keep them from “The Family’s” grasp. Based on Richard Matheson’s classic sci-fi novel “I am a legend”.

results.title: Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Gordon Carroll and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Sam Peckinpah is one of the Western genre’s greatest directors. “Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid” is both a celebration of the mythic West and a eulogy to its passing. James Coburn plays Garrett, still intent on settling his revenge with the outlaw Billy the Kid (Kris Kristofferson). Billy is now tired of being an outlaw, always on the run. The confrontation between these two men forms the core of this film, a battle between old violent codes and a resigned acceptance of vulnerability. Bob Dylan wrote the musical score and he also appears as the mysterious Alias, a member of the Kid’s gang. This haunting film continues Peckinpah’s exploration of the masculine worlds of violence and competition, but the gentle performances of Kristofferson and Dylan look towards a new world based on different values. A classic western.

results.title: The Odd couple
results.creator_credit: Gene Saks, Howard W. Koch and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the Neil Simon play, Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon star in this offbeat comedy about two divorced men who try to share an apartment in New York without killing each other. Lemmon plays the irritating Felix Unger, obsessive and fussy, who proves that cleanliness is not a virtue, but a mental illness! Matthau, plays the slob Oscar Madison, who wreaks havoc on a room with the speed and thoroughness of a tornado. The performances are excellent, and the precision timing of the two actors infuses the film with a sense of spontaneity.

results.title: The Power of one
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises, Studio Canal+ and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bryce Courtenay, this is the story of a young English boy named PK. Orphaned in a foreign land and terrorized for his political beliefs by his schoolmates, the pint-sized youngster turns to the only friend who can help him: a kindly yet world-wise prison inmate who teaches him how to box. As he grows into manhood, he takes on the system and social injustices which arise from Apartheid. Stars Stephen Dorff, Morgan Freeman and Sir John Gielgud and photographed by Australian Dean Semler. One person really can make a difference.

results.title: Indochine [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Regis Wargnier, Jean Labadie, Eric Heumann, Cine 5, Orly Films, Bac Films (France), La Generale D'Images and Paradis Films
results.brief_description: Set in 1930 in French Indochina, on the cusp of revolution, the 1993 Academy Award Winning Best Foreign Film, “Indochine” is the epic story of two women; a French mother and her adopted Indochinese daughter. Their relationship survives social and cultural obstacles, but is ultimately stretched to extremes by their passionate love for the same man. The awesome beauty of Vietnam provides a perfect backdrop for this splendid film. Catherine Deneuve gives a “tour de force” performance. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Paper
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Frederick Zollo, Brian Grazer and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: Today, Henry Hackett (Michael Keaton), Metro editor of a New York tabloid has to make big decisions. His heavily pregnant wife (Marisa Tomei) is facing urgent deadlines of her own. Henry’s boss, the managing editor (Glenn Close) is also reaching a crisis in her life and her senior (Robert Duvall) has just discovered he is an extremely sick man. To top it all, the paper is in pursuit of a hot story that could expose a major scandal and free two innocent boys charged with murder if they can beat the deadline. With the clock ticking, the tension mounts and somewhere amidst the chaos are moments that could change these people’s lives forever. Directed by Ron Howard and also starring Randy Quaid, this film is an inside look at the ruthless and sometimes savage newspaper business.

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: John Beck, Universal International Pictures and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: Based on the Pulitzer prize play written by Mary Chase, James Stewart gives one of his finest performances as Elwood P. Dowd. A good-natured soul, his constant companion is a six-foot-eight rabbit called Harvey, who is only visible to Elwood. To his sister, Veta Louise, Elwood’s obsession with Harvey has been a thorn in the side of her plans to marry off her daughter. When she finally decides to commit Elwood to a mental institution, an hilarious mix-up results in her own committal. Elwood and his imaginary friend finally make things right. At the start of this video, Jimmy Stewart talks about the film and his long association with “Harvey”.
